description: Transitional Aid to Families with Dependent Children provides monthly cash payments to very low-income families.
benefits: Monthly cash payments based on family size and income.
Access to job search assistance through JobQuest.
eligibility_criteria: Have children 18 or younger, or are pregnant and due in less than 4 months.
Massachusetts resident.
Income must be below the TAFDC limit based on family size and housing type.

description: The Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) is a tax credit for low to moderate-income workers.
benefits: Reduces your tax bill or provides a refund based on your income and number of children.
Massachusetts residents may receive additional state credits.

contact_info.agency: IRS and Mass. Department of Revenue

eligibility_criteria: Must have earned income.
Must be 25-65 years old, or have a qualifying child.
Income within EITC limits based on family size.

description: Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program helps low-income households with winter heating costs.
benefits: Energy audits and assistance with energy-saving measures.
eligibility_criteria: Household income must be at or below 60% of the state median income.
Homeowners and renters are eligible.
Must be a Massachusetts resident.

description: A state-funded program providing emergency shelter and assistance finding permanent housing for homeless families.

contact_info.agency: Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD)

eligibility_criteria: Homeless family with children under 21 or a pregnant woman.
Income must be under 115% of the federal poverty level.
Must agree to a Re-Housing Plan.

description: Helps homeless families pay rent for up to 1 year to avoid shelters or to assist with leaving a shelter.
benefits: Funds for first and last month's rent, security deposit, and up to 12 months of rental assistance.

contact_info.agency: Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD)

eligibility_criteria: Must be a homeless family with children under 21 or a pregnant woman.
Income must be under 115% of the federal poverty level.
Must be eligible for Emergency Assistance (EA).

description: Massachusetts' Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program providing health benefits to eligible residents.
benefits: Health coverage for doctor visits, hospital stays, prescription drugs, and more.
eligibility_criteria: Parents of minor children with income up to 133% FPL.
Children under 19 in families up to 150% FPL.
Pregnant women up to 200% FPL.
Disabled adults up to 133% FPL.

description: Affordable health insurance plans with low premiums and no deductibles for Massachusetts residents.
benefits: Low-cost health insurance plans with no deductibles.
Coverage for doctor visits, hospital stays, and prescription drugs.
eligibility_criteria: Income between 133.1% and 300% of the Federal Poverty Level (FPL).
Must not be eligible for MassHealth.
Must be a Massachusetts resident.

program: Residential Assistance for Families in Transition (RAFT)
description: A homelessness prevention program that helps families avoid homelessness by providing financial assistance for housing-related expenses.
benefits: Up to $4,000 for rent, moving costs, utility arrears, and other housing expenses.

contact_info.agency: Department of Housing and Community Development (DHCD)

eligibility_criteria: Family with children under 21 or a pregnant woman.
Household income must be at or below 50% of Area Median Income (AMI).
Must demonstrate that assistance will stabilize housing.

description: Temporary cash benefits for individuals who lost their job through no fault of their own.
benefits: Up to 50% of prior weekly pay, with a maximum of $742 plus $25 per dependent child per week.
eligibility_criteria: Must have worked approximately 15 weeks in the past 15 months.
Must be actively looking for work and able to work.

description: Compensation for workers injured on the job or for families of workers who die due to work-related injuries.
benefits: 60% of gross weekly wage for temporary total incapacity.
67% of wage for permanent total incapacity.

contact_info.agency: Office of Claims Administration, Department of Industrial Accidents (DIA)

eligibility_criteria: Must have lost 5 partial or full working days due to injury.
Injury must be work-related.
